title: Concurrent updates cause data corruption
body: Under load testing, user data gets corrupted. Need proper locking.
label: thread_safety

title: Users persist after deletion
body: The delete_user function appears to be a no-op. Checked the code and it just has `pass` in the if block.
label: delete_user_bug

title: Implement automatic cleanup task
body: Need a background thread that runs `cleanup_expired()` every N seconds.
label: cleanup_task

title: Add type hints throughout codebase
body: Use mypy for type checking.
label: typing_tooling

title: modulo function also has zero division issue
body: Similar to the divide bug, `modulo(5, 0)` also crashes. Should be fixed together with divide.
label: divide_by_zero

title: CacheManager.delete doesn't cleanup ttl_map
body: When deleting a key, we remove from `cache` but not `ttl_map`. This causes memory leak over time.
label: cache_memory_leak

title: delete_user doesn't actually delete users
body: I called `user_manager.delete_user(123)` but the user still shows up in `list_users()`.
label: delete_user_bug

title: Memory leak? Users not being removed
body: Our user list keeps growing even though we're calling delete_user. Is there a memory leak?
label: delete_user_bug

title: SQL injection vulnerability in Database.insert_user
body:
The insert_user method uses f-strings to build queries. This is a critical security vulnerability.

**Exploit:**
```python
db.insert_user("admin' OR '1'='1", ")

idx: Should just return the whole string instead."
title: truncate_edge_case
Make is_palindrome robust to case and spaces
body:
It should:
1. Convert to lowercase
2. Remove spaces
3. Then compare
label: palindrome_case

title: Stack overflow in factorial
body: The factorial function doesn't validate input. Negative numbers cause infinite loop.
label: factorial_validation

title: Use parameterized queries throughout database layer
body: All SQL queries should use `?` placeholders and parameter tuples instead of string formatting.
label: sql_injection

title: ValueError when calculating square root of negative numbers
body:
Calling `sqrt(-1)` raises:
```
ValueError: math domain error
```
Maybe return None or support complex numbers?

body: Truncate should return the full string if requested length exceeds actual length.

body: Found several spelling errors.

title: Palindrome check fails for mixed case strings
body: The function compares raw strings without normalizing case first.

title: truncate throws exception if length is larger than string
body: Python slicing handles this gracefully (`'abc'[:10]` == `'abc'`), but our function raises an error.
label: truncate_edge_case

title: Race condition in UserManager.update_user
body:
When multiple threads update the same user simultaneously, we get corrupted data.

The lock is defined but never used.
label: thread_safety

body: Should wrap all dict modifications in `with self.lock:`

body: Both get() and post() should respect self.timeout.

title: Memory leak in CacheManager
body:
Cache grows indefinitely. Expired entries are never removed automatically.

After 24 hours, memory usage is 2GB+.
label: cache_memory_leak

title: UserManager.delete_user is not implemented
body:
Need to actually delete from self.users dict:
```python
del self.users[user_id]
```

Instead of crashing, we should either:

2. Return None

Palindromes should ignore case by convention.

title: ZeroDivisionError in math_ops.divide
body:
The `divide` function crashes when the second argument is 0.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Call `divide(10, 0)`
2. See error

**Expected:** Should return error message or infinity
**Actual:** Crashes with ZeroDivisionError
label: divide_by_zero

title: Issue 2: Unnecessary 3-Second Delay on All Actions
body:
**Description:**
There is a forced 3-second delay (simulated loading state) applied to critical user actions such as applying a coupon and processing payment. This degrades the user experience and makes the application feel unresponsive.

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1.  Click the "Apply" button for a coupon OR click "Pay Now".
2.  Observe the "Verifying..." or "Processing..." loading overlay.
3.  Time the duration of the overlay.

**Expected Behavior:**
Actions should complete as quickly as the system allows, without artificial delays.

**Actual Behavior:**
Every action is blocked by a 3-second timer before executing.
label: ux_latency

title: Coupon Code "SAVE20" Increases Price Instead of Discounting
body:
Description:
When a user applies the coupon code "SAVE20", the expectation is a 20% discount on the total price. However, the current implementation multiplies the total by 1.2, effectively increasing the price by 20%.

Steps to Reproduce:

Navigate to the checkout page.
Enter "SAVE20" in the Discount Code field.
Click the "Apply" button.
Observe the "Total Due" amount.
Expected Behavior:
The total price should decrease by 20%.

Actual Behavior:
The total price increases by 20%.
label: coupon_bug

title: Coupon Code "SAVE20" Increases Price Instead of Discounting
body:
**Description:**
When a user applies the coupon code "SAVE20", the expectation is a 20% discount on the total price. However, the current implementation multiplies the total by 1.2, effectively increasing the price by 20%.

2.  Enter "SAVE20" in the Discount Code field.
3.  Click the "Apply" button.
